sub.page.body.para: Just how does an expression like

describe a straight motion with constant speed? – The key is to think of the variable t as time and of the vector \mathbf{l}(t) as the position vector of the particle at time t. The result is illustrated below.

In general, the location \mathbf{l}(t) of the particle at time t is found by starting from the tip of \mathbf{a} and moving t units in the direction of \mathbf{v}. As a consequence, for any time t, the displacement of the particle during the time interval [t,t+1] is given by

computation.center:
= Computation of displacement vector
\Vect{l}(t+1) is the position vector of the particle at time t+1; \Vect{l}(t) is the position vector of the particle at time t. Therefore the displacement of the particle during the time interval [t,t+1] is given by \Vect{l}(t+1)-\Vect{l}(t).

sub.page.body.para: So \Vect{v} gives the displacement of the moving particle within any time interval of length 1. This is the reason why we call it the velocity vector.
